chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
A: Set
leA: A -> A -> Prop

Goal:
forall z : List, Descl z -> forall x y : List, z = x ++ y -> Descl x /\ Descl y

Premises:
Notation List := (list A)
Notation Descl := (Desc A leA)
right_prefix : forall x y z : List, ltl x (y ++ z) -> ltl x y \/ (exists y' : List, x = y ++ y' /\ ltl y' z)
left_prefix : forall x y z : List, ltl (x ++ y) z -> ltl x z
Inductive clos_trans (A : Type) (R : Relation_Definitions.relation A) (x : A) : A -> Prop := t_step : forall y : A, R x y -> clos_trans A R x y | t_trans : forall y z : A, clos_trans A R x y -> clos_trans A R y z -> clos_trans A R x z Arguments clos_trans _%type_scope Arguments t_step _%type_scope Arguments t_trans _%type_scope
Setoid.Seq_trans : forall (A : Type) (Aeq : Relation_Definitions.relation A), Setoid.Setoid_Theory A Aeq -> forall x y z : A, Aeq x y -> Aeq y z -> Aeq x z
t_trans : forall (A : Type) (R : Relation_Definitions.relation A) (x y z : A), clos_trans A R x y -> clos_trans A R y z -> clos_trans A R x z
desc_prefix : forall (x : List) (a : A), Descl (x ++ Cons a Nil) -> Descl x
Ring_theory.ARdistr_r : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), RelationClasses.Equivalence req -> Ring_theory.ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> Ring_theory.almost_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req -> forall x y z : R, req (rmul z (radd x y)) (radd (rmul z x) (rmul z y))
desc_tail : forall (x : List) (a b : A), Descl (Cons b (x ++ Cons a Nil)) -> clos_trans A leA a b
Record almost_ring_theory (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop) : Prop := mk_art { ARadd_0_l : forall x : R, req (radd rO x) x; ARadd_comm : forall x y : R, req (radd x y) (radd y x); ARadd_assoc : forall x y z : R, req (radd x (radd y z)) (radd (radd x y) z); ARmul_1_l : forall x : R, req (rmul rI x) x; ARmul_0_l : forall x : R, req (rmul rO x) rO; ARmul_comm : forall x y : R, req (rmul x y) (rmul y x); ARmul_assoc : forall x y z : R, req (rmul x (rmul y z)) (rmul (rmul x...
Ring_theory.ARmul_assoc : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Ring_theory.almost_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req -> forall x y z : R, req (rmul x (rmul y z)) (rmul (rmul x y) z)
Inductive Desc (A : Set) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) : list A -> Prop := d_nil : Desc A leA nil | d_one : forall x : A, Desc A leA (x :: nil) | d_conc : forall (x y : A) (l : list A), leA x y -> Desc A leA (l ++ y :: nil) -> Desc A leA ((l ++ y :: nil) ++ x :: nil) Arguments Desc _%type_scope _%function_scope _%list_scope Arguments d_nil _%type_scope _%function_scope Arguments d_one _%type_scope _%function_scope Arguments d_conc _%type_scope _%function_scope _ _ _%list_scope
Inductive Desc (A : Set) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) : list A -> Prop := d_nil : Relation_Operators.Desc A leA nil | d_one : forall x : A, Relation_Operators.Desc A leA (x :: nil) | d_conc : forall (x y : A) (l : list A), clos_refl A leA x y -> Relation_Operators.Desc A leA (l ++ y :: nil) -> Relation_Operators.Desc A leA ((l ++ y :: nil) ++ x :: nil) Arguments Relation_Operators.Desc _%type_scope _%function_scope _%list_scope Arguments Relation_Operators.d_nil _%type_scope _%function_scope Arguments Relation_Operators.d_one _%type_scope _%function_scope Arguments Relation_Operators.d_conc _%type_scope _%function_scope _ _ _%list_scope
Relation_Operators.Desc_sind : forall (A : Set) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) (P : list A -> SProp), P nil -> (forall x : A, P (x :: nil)) -> (forall (x y : A) (l : list A), clos_refl A leA x y -> Relation_Operators.Desc A leA (l ++ y :: nil) -> P (l ++ y :: nil) -> P ((l ++ y :: nil) ++ x :: nil)) -> forall l : list A, Relation_Operators.Desc A leA l -> P l
Relation_Operators.Desc_ind : forall (A : Set) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) (P : list A -> Prop), P nil -> (forall x : A, P (x :: nil)) -> (forall (x y : A) (l : list A), clos_refl A leA x y -> Relation_Operators.Desc A leA (l ++ y :: nil) -> P (l ++ y :: nil) -> P ((l ++ y :: nil) ++ x :: nil)) -> forall l : list A, Relation_Operators.Desc A leA l -> P l
Desc_ind : forall (A : Set) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) (P : list A -> Prop), P nil -> (forall x : A, P (x :: nil)) -> (forall (x y : A) (l : list A), leA x y -> Desc A leA (l ++ y :: nil) -> P (l ++ y :: nil) -> P ((l ++ y :: nil) ++ x :: nil)) -> forall l : list A, Desc A leA l -> P l
Desc_sind : forall (A : Set) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) (P : list A -> SProp), P nil -> (forall x : A, P (x :: nil)) -> (forall (x y : A) (l : list A), leA x y -> Desc A leA (l ++ y :: nil) -> P (l ++ y :: nil) -> P ((l ++ y :: nil) ++ x :: nil)) -> forall l : list A, Desc A leA l -> P l
d_conc : forall (A : Set) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) (x y : A) (l : list A), leA x y -> Desc A leA (l ++ y :: nil) -> Desc A leA ((l ++ y :: nil) ++ x :: nil)
Relation_Operators.d_conc : forall (A : Set) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) (x y : A) (l : list A), clos_refl A leA x y -> Relation_Operators.Desc A leA (l ++ y :: nil) -> Relation_Operators.Desc A leA ((l ++ y :: nil) ++ x :: nil)
Inductive clos_refl (A : Type) (R : Relation_Definitions.relation A) (x : A) : A -> Prop := r_step : forall y : A, R x y -> clos_refl A R x y | r_refl : clos_refl A R x x Arguments clos_refl _%type_scope Arguments r_step _%type_scope Arguments r_refl _%type_scope
app_eq_unit : forall (A : Type) (x y : list A) (a : A), x ++ y = a :: nil -> x = nil /\ y = a :: nil \/ x = a :: nil /\ y = nil
Setoid.Seq_sym : forall (A : Type) (Aeq : Relation_Definitions.relation A), Setoid.Setoid_Theory A Aeq -> forall x y : A, Aeq x y -> Aeq y x
app_inj_tail : forall (A : Type) (x y : list A) (a b : A), x ++ a :: nil = y ++ b :: nil -> x = y /\ a = b
Inductive Ltl (A : Set) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) : list A -> list A -> Prop := Lt_nil : forall (a : A) (x : list A), Ltl A leA nil (a :: x) | Lt_hd : forall a b : A, leA a b -> forall x y : list A, Ltl A leA (a :: x) (b :: y) | Lt_tl : forall (a : A) (x y : list A), Ltl A leA x y -> Ltl A leA (a :: x) (a :: y) Arguments Ltl _%type_scope _%function_scope (_ _)%list_scope Arguments Lt_nil _%type_scope _%function_scope _ _%list_scope Arguments Lt_hd _%type_scope _%function_scope _ _ _ (_ _)%list_scope Arguments Lt_tl _%type_scope _%function_scope _ (_ _)%list_scope
QArith_base.Q_Setoid = {| RelationClasses.Equivalence_Reflexive := fun x : QArith_base.Q => QArith_base.Qeq_refl x; RelationClasses.Equivalence_Symmetric := fun (x y : QArith_base.Q) (H : QArith_base.Qeq x y) => QArith_base.Qeq_sym x y H; RelationClasses.Equivalence_Transitive := fun (x y z : QArith_base.Q) (H : QArith_base.Qeq x y) (H0 : QArith_base.Qeq y z) => QArith_base.Qeq_trans x y z H H0 |} : RelationClasses.Equivalence QArith_base.Qeq
Lt_tl : forall (A : Set) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) (a : A) (x y : list A), Ltl A leA x y -> Ltl A leA (a :: x) (a :: y)
t_step : forall (A : Type) (R : Relation_Definitions.relation A) (x y : A), R x y -> clos_trans A R x y
Lt_hd : forall (A : Set) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) (a b : A), leA a b -> forall x y : list A, Ltl A leA (a :: x) (b :: y)
Field_theory.rmul_ext : forall (R : Type) (radd rmul : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Ring_theory.ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> forall x y : R, req x y -> forall x0 y0 : R, req x0 y0 -> req (rmul x x0) (rmul y y0)
Record ring_morph (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop) (C : Type) (cO cI : C) (cadd cmul csub : C -> C -> C) (copp : C -> C) (ceqb : C -> C -> bool) (phi : C -> R) : Prop := mkmorph { morph0 : req (phi cO) rO; morph1 : req (phi cI) rI; morph_add : forall x y : C, req (phi (cadd x y)) (radd (phi x) (phi y)); morph_sub : forall x y : C, req (phi (csub x y)) (rsub (phi x) (phi y)); morph_mul : forall x y : C, req (phi (cmul x y)) (rmul (phi x) (phi y)); morph_opp : forall x : C...
QArith_base.Qeq_bool_eq : forall x y : QArith_base.Q, QArith_base.Qeq_bool x y = true -> QArith_base.Qeq x y
